en.title: Cookies
en.paragraph1: A cookie is a small piece of data that’s stored on your computer, tablet, or phone when you visit a website. Most websites need cookies to work properly.
en.howAreCookiesUsedItem1: measure how you use the service so it can be updated and improved based on your needs
en.howAreCookiesUsedItem2: remember the notifications you’ve seen so that you’re not shown them again
en.howAreCookiesUsedItem3: temporarily store the answers you give
en.howAreCookiesUsedParagraph2: Find out more about how to manage cookies.
en.howAreCookiesUsedHeading2: How cookies are used in the adoption service
en.websiteUsageCookiesParagraph1: We use Google Analytics software to collect information about how you use this service. We do this to help make sure the service is meeting the needs of its users and to help us make improvements, for example improving site search.
en.websiteUsageCookiesItem2: how long you spend on each page
en.websiteUsageCookiesItem3: how you got to the service
en.websiteUsageCookiesItem4: what you click on while you’re visiting the service
en.websiteUsageCookiesParagraph3: We allow Google to use or share our analytics data. You can find out more about how Google use this information in their Privacy Policy.
en.websiteUsageCookiesParagraph4: You can opt out of Google Analytics if you do not want Google to have access to your information.
en.websiteUsageCookiesParagraph5: List of google analytics cookies used.
en.websiteUsageCookiesAriaDescribedby: Google Analytics sets the following cookies
en.googleAnalyticsCookiePurpose1: This helps us count how many people visit the service by tracking if you’ve visited before
en.googleAnalyticsCookiePurpose2: Manages the rate at which page view requests are made
en.introMessageCookiesHeading1: To turn our introductory message off
en.introMessageCookiesParagraph1: You may see a pop-up welcome message when you first visit the service. We’ll store a cookie so that your computer knows you’ve seen it and knows not to show it again.
en.introMessageCookiePurpose1: Saves a message to let us know that you’ve seen our cookie message
en.sessionCookiesHeading1: To store the answers you’ve given during your visit (known as a ‘session’)
en.sessionCookiesParagraph1: Session cookies are stored on your computer as you travel through a website, and let the website know what you’ve seen and done so far. These are temporary cookies and are automatically deleted a short while after you leave the website.
en.sessionCookiePurpose1: Carries details of your current session
en.identityCookiesHeading1: To identify you when you come back to the service
en.identityCookiesParagraph1: We use authentication cookies to identify you when you return to the service.
en.securityCookiesHeading1: To make the service more secure
en.securityCookiesParagraph1: We set cookies which prevent attackers from modifying the contents of the other cookies we set. This makes the service more secure and protects your personal information.
en.securityCookiePurpose2: Identifies you to the service and secures your authentication
en.dynatraceCookiesParagraph1: We use Dynatrace Software Intelligence Platform to provide an Application Performance Monitoring Service to collect information about how you use HMCTS services. We do this to monitor HMCTS services in order to resolve issues within our services as well as collect data on how our services can be improved. HMCTS store information about:
en.dynatraceCookiesParagraph2: Information is presented within the Application Performance Monitoring service for the purposes detailed above. We do not use or share the information for any other purpose. We do not allow Dynatrace to use or share the information for any other purposes.
en.dynatraceCookiesPurpose1: Tracks a visit across multiple request
en.dynatraceCookiesPurpose2: Measures server latency for performance monitoring
en.dynatraceCookiesPurpose3: Required to identify proper endpoints for beacon transmission; includes session ID for correlation
